answers.answer: i wouldn't be too worried yet. late measurements can be off.My poor friend went through a terrible time. At 37 weeks she was told her baby's limbs measured way too short. She was basically told that her baby was most likely a dwarf and would most likely have other serious complications as well. She was absolutely devistated and had to go through the last few weeks of her pregnancy knowing that something was wrong with the baby. I can't even imagine... anyways, they delivered via c-section with specialists on hand... and the baby was born perfectly normal. she's kinda petite, but perfectly healthy.

question: I am currently 34 weeks pregnant.  I have placenta previa and also gestational diabetes.  I had diabetes with my first child, but this one has been more diffiucult.  I am taking insulin injections and testing all the time along with following a low-carb diet.  I had an US on Wednesday because I am high-risk.  They told me today (Friday) that the head was measuring at 31 weeks while the rest of his body was measuring on track at 34.  What does this mean?  My doctor said she really didn't know and she was sending me to a specialist next week.  I am nervous about this.  Should I be worried?
title: Ultrasound and small head at 34 weeks
